intro: Stenanthemum pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf stenanthemum, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is adapted to rocky and sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
